intro: Gomphrena tarijensis, commonly known as the Andean feverfew, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branched. Gomphrena tarijensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
